frame.name: Physical_entity
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> exists in some <fen>Place</fen> at some time.</def-root>

FE.name: Constituents
FE.definition:
<def-root>Salient parts or substances that make up an <fen>Entity</fen>. At this level of abstraction, not every <fen>Entity</fen> is conceived of as having parts, though any normal entity has them.
<ex>A <fex name="Constituents">bronze</fex> <t>sword</t> is nearly as strong as the steel ones .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>A thing (either abstract or physical) that exists with some degree of permanence. </def-root>

FE.name: Formational_cause
FE.definition: <def-root>Indicates the action (or causer) which made or makes the <fen>Entity</fen> what it is. <ex><fex name="Formational_cause">glacial</fex> <t>valley</t></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>A label applied to a specific <fen>Entity</fen>. Not usual for general words inheriting from this frame, but common for Locales.
<ex><t>Keyboard</t> <fex name="Name">1</fex> has all the right features .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to. When a subtype is signified by some more specific FE, like <fen>Formational_cause</fen>, we use that more specific FE instead of <fen>Type</fen>, so this FE is most often needed when there is a vague or unknown relation between a name that indicates the <fen>Type</fen> and the <fen>Type</fen> of <fen>Entity</fen> in question. This FE is normally found as a pre-nominal modifier. <ex>We use only <fex name="Type">d'Arbin</fex> <t>pottery</t> .</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>A place that a physical <fen>Entity</fen> is located with respect to.
<ex>All the <t>stuff</t> <fex name="Place">on the bureau</fex> is small.</ex></def-root>
